SEARCH
Module klotski_ids
Package klotski_ids.controllers.frameMenu

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
klotski_ids.controllers.frameMenu.GameController
public class GameController extends Object
The GameController class controls the behavior of the game. It handles mouse events to allow

the user to drag and drop puzzle pieces, and updates the number of moves made.

  • Method Details

    • setGridPaneElements

      private void setGridPaneElements()
      Sets the elements in the GridPane using the components and rectangles from the KlotskiGame.

    • isWinSet

      private void isWinSet()
      Checks if the KlotskiGame has reached a winning state. If so, loads the mainView.fxml and sets it as the scene.

    • setMouseEventHandlers

      private void setMouseEventHandlers() throws IOException
      Sets the mouse event handlers for the GridPane. If the Python installation check using Helper.PythonInstallationChecker() returns false and the game is resumed, disables the nextBestMove button. Sets the mouse event handlers using the setMouseEvent() method for the GridPane and rectangles.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input/output exception occurs while setting the mouse event handlers.

    • setMousePressed

      private void setMousePressed(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Sets the mouse pressed event handler for the given rectangle. Updates the initial values for mouse movement tracking and changes the cursor.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - The rectangle to set the mouse pressed event handler for.

    • setMouseDragged

      private void setMouseDragged(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Sets the mouse dragged event handler for the given grid pane and rectangle. Handles the movement of the rectangle during mouse dragging.
      Parameters:
      gridPane - The grid pane that contains the rectangle.
      rectangle - The rectangle to set the mouse dragged event handler for.

    • setMouseReleased

      private void setMouseReleased(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rectangle)
      Sets the mouse released event handler for the given rectangle. Resets the cursor and updates the number of moves.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - The rectangle to set the mouse released event handler for.

    • setMouseEvent

      private void setMouseEvent(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, List<javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle> rectangleList)
      Sets the mouse event handlers for the given grid pane and rectangle list.
      Parameters:
      gridPane - The grid pane that contains the rectangles.
      rectangleList - The list of rectangles to set the mouse event handlers for.

    • reset

      private void reset() throws IOException
      Resets the game state and navigates to the game screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • save

      private void save()
      Saves the current game level to a JSON file.

    • nextBestMove

      private void nextBestMove() throws IOException
      Performs the next best move in the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • undo

      private void undo()
      Reverts the last move and restores the previous game state.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(Level level, String filePath, boolean isResumed) throws IOException
      Initializes the game with the specified level, file path, and resume flag.
      Parameters:
      level - The level to initialize the game with.
      filePath - The file path of the level.
      isResumed - A flag indicating if the game is being resumed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs during initialization.
